properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Unseasonably warm weather expected for the start of the Canada Day weekend. Today and Sunday are shaping up to be sunny with afternoon cloudy periods and isolated afternoon showers on Sunday. Temperatures will be about 5 degrees above seasonal normals for the period. Temperatures will be close to the Heat Warning criteria of at least 28 C for two or more consecutive days with an overnight low above 13 C. However, the amount of cloud cover, forest fire smoke and overnight cooling are still uncertain at this time and will play a major role in determining the temperatures. A Heat Warning may be issued later if conditions warrant. - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Contact your local government to find out what services (such as air-conditioned buildings and public splash parks) are available in your area. - Environment and Climate Change Canada and Regional Medical Health officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-29T20:45:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T12:46:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2017403534.2019
Area: Dawson, Mayo, Beaver Creek, Pelly - Carmacks
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is creating locally reduced visibilities and producing poor air quality. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-30T02:38:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-29T10:39:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0828036182.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms today. These storms may produce wind gusts up to 40 knots as well as heavy downpours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain this afternoon and evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First heat event of the season ends tonight. One more hot and humid day is expected today with afternoon temperatures in the low thirties and humidex values nudging 40. The hot and humid air today can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. A cooler and considerably less humid air mass is expected to arrive from the northwest this evening, with temperatures several degrees lower on Sunday. Hot and humid weather is expected to return to the area early next week. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T02:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T14:33:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3558652863.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A multi-day heat event continues through the long weekend. After some brief relief early this morning with temperature dipping to the low to mid teens in many areas, temperatures will once again soar to near the 30 degree mark this afternoon. Temperatures tonight will likely fall to the upper teens, providing little relief from the heat. Additionally humidex values will likely reach the high thirties, particularly near the Minnesota border. Slightly lower temperatures are expected to arrive early next week. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T06:50:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T14:51:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1431066465.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A line of severe thunderstorms is tracking eastward into Westman early this morning. Warnings continue to be added as this line progresses east. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-29T17:22:43-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Conditions are favourable for severe thunderstorms to develop in the afternoon and early this evening. The main threats will be damaging winds and nickel size hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-30T02:49:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T14:50:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1930467415.2019

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 35 are expected for the next 3 days. A multi-day heat event continues through the long weekend. After some brief relief early this morning with temperature dipping to the low to mid teens in many areas, temperatures will once again soar to near the 30 degree mark this afternoon. Temperatures tonight will likely fall to the upper teens, providing little relief from the heat. Additionally humidex values will likely reach the high thirties, particularly near the Minnesota border. Slightly lower temperatures are expected to arrive next week. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T01:07:05-00:00
